definitions.definition: To incur, stand, or bear without serious detriment, as an act which might under other circumstances be injurious;—with an auxiliary, as can, could, might, etc.; to be able or rich enough.
definitions.example: I think we can afford the extra hour it will take.  We can only afford to buy a small car at the moment.

definitions.definition: To offer, provide, or supply, as in selling, granting, expending, with profit, or without loss or too great injury.
definitions.example: A affords his goods cheaper than B.

definitions.definition: To give forth; to supply, yield, or produce as the natural result, fruit, or issue.
definitions.example: Grapes afford wine.  Olives afford oil.  The earth affords fruit.  The sea affords an abundant supply of fish.

definitions.definition: To give, grant, or confer, with a remoter reference to its being the natural result; to provide; to furnish.
definitions.example: A good life affords consolation in old age.
